articles.title: More F-15 fighter planes deployed
articles.content:
More F-15 fighter planes deployed
    Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The U.S. additionally deployed in South Korea 12 F-15 fighter planes from their mainland on Wednesday, according to a Seoul-based radio report.   Earlier, the warmongers introduced a large number of war equipment including ground attack planes and fighter bombers till last April. They are scheming to bring in six fighter planes in near future.   This is  part of foolish war maneuvers of the warlike forces to unleash a new war of aggression in the Korean peninsula under the signboard of filling up the "vacuum of combat power" from the Yugoslav crisis.

articles.title: S. Korean workers go on overall strike
articles.content:
S. Korean workers go on overall strike
    Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- More than 2,700 members of the Ulsan Factory Trade Union under the Hyun Dai Precision Ind. Co., Ltd. went on an overall strike against the "restructuring" on Wednesday, according to a South Korean newspaper.   They strongly called for stable jobs.   On the same day the trade union held departmental meetings and declared that it would intensify the strike until their just demands are met.

S. Korean rulers scheme to buy aircraft
articles.content:
S. Korean rulers scheme to buy aircraft
    Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The South Korean authorities plan to purchase five airplanes of new type from France by late July, a South Korean newspaper said.
   The aircraft is said to be used for leading an air target for naval gunfire exercise and for sea patrol.
   The authorities have allocated 33 billion won for the purchase of those planes.

Kim Yong Nam receives credentials from Nigeria
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam receives credentials from Nigeria
   Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Nigerian Ambassador E.P. to Korea Adoga Onah presented his credentials to Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.   Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun was present there.   The president conversed with the ambassador after receiving the credentials.

articles.title: Greetings to speaker of Finnish parliament
articles.content:
Greetings to speaker of Finnish parliament
   Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Riitta Uosukainen upon his election as speaker of the Finnish parliament.    Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries and parliaments will develop on good terms in conformity with the idea of independence, peace and friendship, the message wished the speaker greater success in his responsible work.
